0.text: The widespread availability of generative AI models poses a threat to human connection.
0.quote: My central contention is that, insofar as the widespread availability of AI models threatens human creativity, it threatens our ability to connect with other humans.

1.text: AI poses a threat to human creativity.
1.quote: The subtle threat I have in mind here can be captured with an analogy. It is akin to the threat my smart phone poses to my attention span.

2.text: If AI poses a threat to human creativity, it would be a bad thing.
2.quote: If it would, there must be some value of human creativity that is not secured by reliance on AI.

3.text: Human creativity plays an important role in connecting us to others.
3.quote: The notion of ÒconnectionÓ I have in mind here is quite broad.

4.quote: I follow Gary Watson in using the term to refer to something that happens when we exercise our agency in ways that give us a kind of ownership over our actions.

5.quote: Because creativity is driven by our curiosity, our creative pursuits demonstrate who we are as inquirers in an especially transparent way.

6.text: The inquisitive self is a particularly important aspect of a person to get to know if you wish to form a meaningful connection with them.
6.quote: It is important to understand someoneÕs inquisitive self if you want to understand their perspective.

7.text: Self-disclosure is especially valuable in the context of human connection.
7.quote: Creativity is especially disclosive of the inquisitive self, both in how much is information disclosed and how reliably accurate the information is.

8.text: Scientific creativity is self-disclosive in a way that enables human connection.
8.quote: Creative theorizing thus enables the sharing of ideas among scientists.

9.text: The widespread availability of AI models poses a threat to human creativity.
9.quote: This is the notion of ÒthreatÓ I have in mind in considering whether AI poses a threat to human creativity.

10.text: Human creativity is especially valuable for human connection.
10.quote: Creativity is especially valuable for human connection because it discloses the inquisitive self.

11.text: The temptation to outsource creative work to AI is strong and growing stronger.
11.quote: The idea that one can inhibit social connection by choosing ways of living that impede self-disclosure appears in Ralph Waldo EmersonÕs essay Self-Reliance.

12.text: The tendency to conceive of what generative AI can do as fully replacing the important role played by human creativity in science is a threat to scientific creativity.
12.quote: This tendency poses a threat to scientific creativity and consequently to the human connection via shared understanding of the natural world that creative scientific theorizing facilitates.

15.text: Letting ourselves become less creative in the age of AI poses a threat to our ability to connect with each other.
15.quote: I have argued that letting ourselves become less creative in the age of AI poses a threat to our ability to connect with each other.

16.text: The self-disclosure that occurs when we are creative makes it possible for others to understand us.
16.quote: This is essential for both our interpersonal relationships and a broader sense of human connection that includes the resonance of othersÕ art and the apprehension of othersÕ ideas.

17.text: The self-disclosure that occurs when we are creative is especially valuable for human connection.

18.text: The widespread availability of generative AI models is making human creativity obsolete.
18.quote: If we can get the benefits of creative work without the costs, perhaps creativity can be made normatively obsolete.

19.text: Human creativity has value that cannot be secured by AI.
19.quote: If creativity has some value that cannot be secured by AI, and yet AIÕs widespread availability is a threat to our creativity (in the same way that my smart phone is a threat to my attention span), then we may lose that value Ð whatever it is Ð without realizing it.

20.text: AI can produce outputs that are valuable in many of the same ways that the products of genuine creativity are often valuable.
20.quote: Human creativity is often prized for its products. Among other things, our creative achievements have given us powerful art, successful scientific theories, and solutions to complex problems.

21.text: AI can produce outputs that are aesthetically, scientifically, and practically valuable.
21.quote: AI models have produced images humans find beautiful and jokes humans find funny.
